Building with Robots |
  • Welcome

Robotics with mBot

Welcome to Programming with Robots! This workshop is designed to introduce you to the basics of programming robots to do cool things.

Say hi to your mentors!

Your mentors are here to help if you get stuck,
and you can ask them (almost) anything!

Your mentors are super friendly, make sure to say hi. They actually get paid to do this stuff for a job, which is super cool. You can ask them for help with your code, ask them about their day job, or ask them what their favourite colour is. They're here to help, so ask them anything :)

Introductions

What is your:

  • Favourite thing?
  • Future?
  • First name?
Let's quickly go around the room and introduce ourselves. Tell us all one of your favourite things - favourite food, sport, hobby, animal, anything! If you could choose one super power, which would it be? Last of all, tell us your name.

Schedule

3D Printing

Morning Break

Robotics Intro

Lunch Break

Robotics Programming

Today's workshop is arranged in six different sections. In the first part we will look at basic motion and features, and also try out some programs and do a few challenges. After that we will move on to more difficult stuff like sensors and control statements you can use. Later we will program with remote controls and use ultrasonic sensors, yay!

mBot

Ensure you install mBlock.

Download link

:)

Install apple Driver

Make sure to install this driver so your computer can talk to your mBot.

Download link

This driver is for Mac only, if you have windows then go connect->install arduino driver.

Install Windows Driver

If you have windows simply click on install arduino driver

You may have to download a seperate driver if it doesnt work, USB stick.

Connect mBot


  • Plug cable in.

  • Turn robot on.

  • Connect robot to mBlock.

Note that if you can’t see the COM port, then you probably have issues with your driver.

:) :) :)

Are you connected?


If your mBlock program says connected at the top, then you are ready to go!

:)
